question_sentence: Which candidate conceded the Republican congressional primary in North Carolina after receiving 32% of the votes?
Which school’s football program did Alabama coach Nick Saban say "bought every player on their team”?
The first US case of monkeypox this year was reported in which state?
This week, Target stock had its worst one-day decline since:
Taylor Swift delivered the commencement speech and received an honorary degree from which university this week?
Which US sport’s organization announced contracts to pay its men’s and women’s national teams equally?
The United States reached a grim milestone this week. How many Americans have died from COVID-19 since the pandemic began?
After being removed in 2020, which beloved Taco Bell menu item returned this week?
As temperatures rise, some animals seek cool places for shelter. What did a Texas family find in their pool noodle?
President Joe Biden embarked on his first trip to Asia as president. What countries will he visit?
Jake Daniels became the UK’s first male professional footballer to come out as gay since 1990. Which Championship team does he play for?
evidence: In an interview with Sky Sports, the striker said that he wanted people ‘to know the real me’ and thanked his club for being ‘absolutely amazing’

question_sentence: Twenty people in the UK have been diagnosed with which rare viral zoonosis with similar symptoms to smallpox?
evidence: The first case, reported on 5 May, was in a patient who had recently returned from Nigeria

question_sentence: Defending champion Phil Mickelson is not playing in golf’s US PGA Championship this weekend. How many majors has the 51-year-old American won in his career?
evidence: Mickelson’s famous popularity has declined in recent months after it was revealed that he was considering joining a Saudi-backed rebel tour, led by Australian former Open champion Greg Norman

question_sentence: Which London station will not be ready when the Elizabeth line officially opens for passengers next week?
evidence: Bond Street will not open with the rest of the line but will be ready in late 2022 when direct through trains from the west and east sections also start running under central London

question_sentence: What is the name of the new tank being deployed by Russia in the battle for control of Donbas in Ukraine?
evidence: The BMPT tank, nicknamed ‘Terminator’, is being sent by Vladimir Putin to help troops fighting to consolidate Russian control over Ukraine’s eastern region

question_sentence: Which West Yorkshire seat is gearing up for a by-election next month after the resignation of Tory MP Imran Ahmad Khan, who was convicted of sexually assaulting a child?
evidence: A by-election in Tiverton and Honiton has also been triggered after Conservative MP Neil Parish quit after being caught watching pornography in the Commons chamber

question_sentence: Which Nato member state has threatened to derail plans to fast-track Finland and Sweden’s membership of the Western military alliance?
evidence: President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has doubled down on his threat to veto the Nordic duo’s application, citing their support for two Kurdish militias in Iraq and Syria

question_sentence: Joe Biden reversed a Donald Trump-era decision to withdraw US troops from the battle against terrorism in which African nation?
evidence: Washington will send up to 500 soldiers to train the country’s army to combat the increasing threat posed by al-Shabaab militants

question_sentence: Which city did Levelling Up Secretary Michael Gove suggest the House of Lords could relocate to during a refurbishment of Parliament?
evidence: The Queen Elizabeth II Centre, a government-owned conference hall close to Parliament, has also been suggested as a possible new location for the Lords

question_sentence: In total, how many fines were handed out to politicians and civil servants as part of the Metropolitan Police’s Partygate investigation?
evidence: The Met said it had issued 126 fixed penalty notices to 83 people, including Boris Johnson, his wife Carrie and Rishi Sunak

question_sentence: After more than 50 years, a House panel this week held a highly anticipated open congressional hearing about a topic often shrouded in secrecy. What was the hearing about?
evidence: Key lawmakers warned at a public House hearing on Tuesday that unidentified aerial phenomena – popularly known as UFOs – must be investigated and taken seriously as a potential threat to national security.

question_sentence: Which NBA star graduated from college this week?
evidence: Three-time NBA championship winner Steph Curry graduated from Davidson College this week with his bachelor’s degree. Curry, 34, only needed to finish one semester of coursework to complete his degree, the college said in a statement. He matriculated at the college in 2006 and opted out of his senior year when he was drafted by the Golden State Warriors.

question_sentence: One manufacturer is at the heart of a nationwide baby formula recall after bacteria was found in some of its formula batches in 2019 and 2020. In which state is the company’s plant located?
evidence: Baby formula manufacturer Abbott Nutrition reached an agreement with the FDA that may soon allow production to resume at its plant in Sturgis, Michigan, within two weeks. Production at the facility was halted in February after four infants who drank formula manufactured at the plant fell ill with rare and serious bacterial infections.

question_sentence: Dr. Anthony Fauci says he would not continue to serve in his current role if former President Donald Trump was elected to a second term. What is Fauci’s role?
evidence: Dr. Anthony Fauci, President Biden’s chief medical adviser, was a leading member of Trump’s White House coronavirus task force when the virus took hold in the US in 2020 – but often disagreed with the administration over its handling of the pandemic.

question_sentence: The Biden administration this week announced policies to make it easier for families to visit relatives in which country?
evidence: President Biden has reversed some Trump-era policies related to Cuba. The new changes are aimed at supporting the Cuban people, including measures to bolster consular services and visa processing.

question_sentence: The Calf Canyon/Hermits Peak Fire became the largest fire in New Mexico’s history. Approximately how many acres has it burned?
evidence: The Calf Canyon/Hermit Peak Fire has now burned more than 301,000 acres and prompted at least 26,000 thousand evacuations, officials said.

question_sentence: Maye Musk, the 74-year-old mother of billionaire of Elon Musk, made headlines this week when she did what?
evidence: Maye Musk became the oldest Sports Illustrated Swimsuit cover model. She is one of four SI Swimsuit 2022 cover models, along with reality star Kim Kardashian, singer Ciara and musician and fashion entrepreneur Yumi Nu.

question_sentence: What unusual global competition recently took place?
evidence: Individuals from around the world participated in the World Paper Airplane Championship. At the competition, one competitor threw a paper airplane 200.49 feet – almost the length of six school buses placed end-to-end!

question_sentence: In which country did the United States reopen its embassy this week?
evidence: In a show of support for the Ukrainian government, the US reopened its embassy in Kyiv, Ukraine, this week after it closed three months ago ahead of Russia’s invasion.

question_sentence: After a long fight, which US sport agreed to a landmark equal pay deal for women?
evidence: US Soccer has agreed to an equal pay deal for women. US Soccer, under the agreement, will become “the first Federation in the world to equalize FIFA World Cup prize money” awarded to the teams for participating in World Cups.
